paragraphs.name: 73fe
paragraphs.text: I have no rules for my notebook except that it stays with me. I carry it in my purse. (Never mug me. This thing will knock you out if I take a swing at your head with my handbag. Just saying.)
A new (to me) concept for keeping a notebook.
paragraphs.name: 8be7

d0aabcbd39ab.title: I have been so critical of myself for using notebooks in that fashion.

paragraphs.text: I have been so critical of myself for using notebooks in that fashion. And now it has a NAME! Beautiful! So I have resurrected my doodling habit, and now my writing notes habit, and I am glad about that.

paragraphs.name: eaa8
paragraphs.text: Wow. Revelatory.

paragraphs.name: 7a40
paragraphs.text: I have created an online service called litePIM, which is a personal information manager. It includes a notebook module that I use to keep my notes. It is web-based, so I can access my notes on my computer, on my tablet and on my smartphone without having to install an app!

b64e250d4eb4.title: I’ve been hand-drawing planners in notebooks for years and years, so I’m absolutely delighted by…

paragraphs.text: I’ve been hand-drawing planners in notebooks for years and years, so I’m absolutely delighted by the proliferation of bullet journaling and BuJos this last few years. I spend a LOT of time in my notebooks, and I constantly assess how it’s working for me. I’m constantly fine-tuning my system. Right now, I’m working out of two notebooks, one — a…

64bfe90f8013.title: I’m a ‘needle-drop’ kinda guy too…the first draft of everything I write is by hand, and must be on…

paragraphs.name: 55a7
paragraphs.text: I’m a ‘needle-drop’ kinda guy too…the first draft of everything I write is by hand, and must be on a yellow-lined pad. I start in the middle and work out from the centre writing at an angle to the lines…don’t ask me why, it just started that way, and that’s the way it is :)

618586897076.title: …I write out in a clockwise spiral and end up using all the available space; text islands of…

paragraphs.name: 41df
paragraphs.text: …I write out in a clockwise spiral and end up using all the available space; text islands of thoughts and ideas…I call that my rubbish draft…days later, I try to figure out what I was attempting to say, and then bang it into a shape and order that might actually be meaningful. I’ve written four plays this way, and all of my blog posts. I guess its a…

paragraphs.text: I’ve been a longtime user of notebooks. They never crash, they never require upgrades. However, I like to have some fun. I use a fountain pen. I like the feel of the pen on the paper.

paragraphs.name: 229b
paragraphs.text: I was with you up until the index cards. I’ve also tried BuJos and, like you, found the brain dumping being the most beneficial part (I also couldn’t seem to make myself draw a new layout every week). But what do you DO with the index cards? I feel like I would write down my most important ideas and then have random stacks of cards lying around the…
